title: 105_hr1381
content: REVOLVING FUND. The United States Institute for Environmental Conflict Resolution Revolving Fund is established in the Treasury, administered by the Foundation. The Fund consists of appropriated amounts and payments. The Foundation will use the Fund for necessary expenses to operate the Institute, including salaries, mediation services, and other reasonable expenses as determined by the Board. The Revolving Fund, separate from the Trust Fund, is used for operating the Institute, including salaries and mediation services. It is not subject to certain program priorities and investments are made in interest-bearing obligations of the United States. The Revolving Fund is used for operating the Institute, including salaries and mediation services. Investments are made in interest-bearing obligations of the United States, which can be acquired on original issue or by purchase, and sold at market price. Interest and proceeds from the obligations are credited to the Revolving Fund. The Morris K. Udall Scholarship and Excellence in National Environmental and Native American Public Policy Act of 1992 is amended to allow the use of the Institute by a federal agency. The Morris K. Udall Scholarship and Excellence in National Environmental and Native American Public Policy Act of 1992 is amended to authorize federal agencies to utilize the Foundation and Institute for assessment, mediation, or related services in disputes concerning the environment, public lands, or natural resources. Federal agencies can contract and pay for Institute services, with payments going into a Revolving Fund. Notification and concurrence procedures are also outlined. Federal agencies must notify the chairperson of the President's Council on Environmental Quality before using the Foundation or Institute for services related to environmental disputes. The notification must include details on the issues, parties involved, prior efforts to address the issues, and other relevant information. Federal agencies must obtain the concurrence of the chairperson of the President's Council on Environmental Quality before utilizing the Foundation or Institute for services in cases involving disputes between federal agencies. SEC. 8. Authorization of appropriations for the Trust Fund and Revolving Fund, with specific amounts allocated for fiscal years 1998 through 2002. SEC. 9. Conforming amendments. SEC. 9 of the Morris K. Udall Scholarship and Excellence in National Environmental and Native American Public Policy Act of 1992 makes conforming amendments related to the Trust Fund, replacing "fund" with "Trust Fund" in various sections.
